description: Test messages for validating Second Brain classification

examples.message: Met Sarah Johnson at DevOps Days - she's a platform engineer at CloudCorp, really knowledgeable about Kubernetes and service mesh architectures
Need to follow up with David Chen about the Q2 infrastructure roadmap and his team's capacity planning concerns
Emily mentioned she's looking for good resources on GitOps practices and ArgoCD implementation patterns
John Smith referred me to his contact at AWS - Alex Rodriguez who leads their DevOps Professional Services team
examples.expected_details: Referral to Alex Rodriguez at AWS

examples.message: Talked to Maria about her experience migrating from Jenkins to GitHub Actions - she has great insights on incremental migration strategies
examples.expected_details: Jenkins to GitHub Actions migration experience

examples.message: Implement feature flags in the frontend application using LaunchDarkly to enable gradual rollout of new UI components
examples.expected_next_action: Set up LaunchDarkly account and integrate SDK

examples.message: Migrate the user authentication service from monolithic database to distributed cache layer with Redis for improved performance
examples.expected_next_action: Design cache schema and invalidation strategy

examples.message: Build comprehensive monitoring dashboard for microservices health using Grafana - include latency, error rates, and throughput metrics
examples.expected_next_action: Set up Grafana instance and configure data sources

examples.message: Refactor the payment processing module to handle idempotency properly and add retry logic with exponential backoff
examples.expected_next_action: Implement idempotency keys in payment API

examples.message: Set up CI/CD pipeline for the new microservice using GitHub Actions with automated testing, security scanning, and deployment to EKS
What if we applied chaos engineering principles to our database layer? Could randomly inject latency or partition failures to test resilience
Interesting concept: use event sourcing for the audit log instead of traditional CRUD. Would give us complete history replay capability and temporal queries
examples.expected_details: Complete history replay and temporal queries

examples.message: Could we use AI to automatically categorize and prioritize technical debt based on code complexity metrics and change frequency?
examples.expected_details: Based on complexity and change frequency

examples.message: Thinking about implementing canary deployments at the database migration level - gradually roll out schema changes with automatic rollback on errors
What if we built a custom Kubernetes operator that automatically scales databases based on query pattern analysis rather than just CPU/memory?
Schedule annual security audit and penetration testing for Q2 compliance requirements
Renew SSL certificates for production domains - they expire on March 15th
examples.expected_next_action: Generate CSR and submit renewal request

examples.message: Submit Q1 cloud infrastructure budget report showing 15% cost reduction from rightsizing efforts
examples.expected_next_action: Compile cost metrics and prepare report

examples.message: Book conference room for architecture review meeting next Wednesday at 2pm
Update emergency contact information in HR system and verify PagerDuty on-call rotation

usage.manual_testing: Copy messages from examples and post to Slack #sb-inbox
usage.automated_testing: Use send-test-messages.sh script to test all categories
